channel.title: Mashable on Nootícias
channel.description: Recent content in Mashable on Nootícias

item.title: Behind the mysterious stock dump ahead of Trump's Lockheed Martin tweet
item.description: When it began pinging around on Twitter, the graph raised suspicion.

item.title: 'Chewbacca mom' gets her own TLC digital shows, because of course
item.description: “Chewbacca Mom” Candace Payne is riding her viral fame into the holidays.

item.title: Hulu teases intense Season 2 of 'The Path'
item.description: Season two of Hulu’s The Path looks even more intense than Season 1.

item.title: Verizon will finally kill the Galaxy Note 7... after the holidays
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy Note 7’s death throes will continue into 2017 — but the end is in sight.

item.title: This heartwarming Christmas ad will have you reaching for the tissues
item.description: WestJet is hoping to lift the spirits of a Canadian town that’s had a rough year in its latest Christmas marketing stunt.

item.title: So much complaining: 'Super Mario Run' will destroy your data and drain your wallet
item.description: After Nintendo’s iOS debut Super Mario Run dropped Thursday, the rush to download it and start playing was real.

item.title: NASA used a plane to launch new hurricane-hunting micro-satellites
item.description: On Thursday morning, NASA successfully launched a group of eight micro-satellites for its Cyclone Global Navigation Satellite System (CYGNSS) mission via a rocket launched from the belly of the large Orbital ATK Stargazer airplane. And, yes, it was as cool as it sounds.

item.title: YouTube wants YouTubers to be less angry about subscriptions
item.description: “YouTube doesn’t unsubscribe people from channels.”…

item.title: 7 things to get excited about in the upcoming 'Doctor Who' episodes
item.description: Warning: We’ve tried to keep this piece as spoiler free as possible, but there are some hints about the upcoming Doctor Who Christmas special below (and some teases for the new 2017 series, based on a Q & A with the cast that took place after the screening).

item.title: 'Passengers' is a boring mess, unfortunately
item.description: “There’s a reason we woke up early,” Chris Pratt ominously declares in the Passengers trailer after he and Jennifer Lawrence wake up from their hibernation during a space mission.

item.title: Eva Longoria, Andy Cohen added to jury for Tribeca Film Festival's Snapchat competition
item.description: Snapchat and the Tribeca Film Festival are joining forces for a second year in a row.

item.title: Facebook’s fake news fix comes way too late
item.description: Why does it always take the worst thing that could possibly happen to spark reform?

item.title: These moving 3-D printed sculptures are actually optical illusions
item.description: The Grammy Awards telecast officially kicked off at 8 p.m. ET — but a whole gaggle of awards were handed out before the show began, making winners of stars including Taylor Swift and Bruno Mars.

item.title: These moving 3-D printed sculptures are actually optical illusions
item.description: Is it Groundhog Day? Verizon is once again reconsidering an acquisition of Yahoo, Bloomberg reported Thursday.

item.title: Verizon is reportedly thinking about exiting Yahoo deal
item.description: Is it Groundhog Day? Verizon is once again reconsidering an acquisition of Yahoo, Bloomberg reported Thursday.

item.title: Facebook continues to ban Snapchat QR codes from Pages and profiles
item.description: Facebook seems to be a big fan of Snapchat’s product, but it doesn’t want to help spread the love to the app.

item.title: Bostonians share how tech has transformed their life in the city (Promoted by Capital One)
item.description: We all have been influenced by technology. We use it for the most basic things – communication, navigation, you name it.

item.title: Some of the best things in life – and Boston – are free (Promoted by Capital One)
item.description: From buskers, to free samples, to the public library and beyond, Boston offers some of the best cultural and entertaining activities in the country at a very reasonable price – free!

item.title: Postmates wants you to give the gift of expensive delivery this holiday season
item.description: What’s the perfect last-minute gift? Delivery.

item.title: Facebook Messenger's latest attempt to hijack your social life
item.description: LONDON — Facebook really wants you to hang out and talk about your feelings. But, does it want you to have those conversations anywhere else other than on Messenger? Probably not.

item.title: Musical Christmas necktie accidentally undercuts parliament member's passionate speech
item.description: We’ve all been there – we’re trying to ask a serious question about an asbestos report when our electronic, holiday-themed necktie starts playing a jubilant tune.

item.title: Brutal video shows a mountain lion dragging a deer off surburban porch
item.description: Even the safety of the suburbs can’t save you from the brutality of Mother Nature.

item.title: Woman skips holiday decor, wants to use her neighbor's Christmas lights instead
item.description: Unwilling to compete with a neighboring home’s impressive Christmas light display, Jami Kelly of Michigan decided her best bet was to publicly acknowledge her neighbor’s hard work.

item.title: 'Superstore' launches digital episodes to get you through the holiday hiatus
item.description: It’s hard to be without your favorite shows over the holiday break, but NBC has you covered — starting today, you can laugh away your winter blues with eight brand new digital episodes of Superstore.

item.title: Gov. Brown: California will build its 'own damn' climate satellites under Trump
item.description: California has a back-up plan if President-elect Donald Trump cuts funding for NASA’s fleet of Earth-observing satellites, which are crucial to gathering climate change data.

item.title: TurboTax introduces a tax service just for gig workers
item.description: The gig economy is only growing, and TurboTax knows it.

item.title: Instagram now has almost twice the number of users as the entire U.S. population
item.description: Instagram has officially hit a major milestone: the 600 million monthly user mark.

item.title: 'Fallout' characters and locations are coming to 'Minecraft'
item.description: War. War never changes. Even when it’s recreated in the blocky domain of Minecraft.

item.title: Lucky hedgehog experiences pure bliss during ever-so-gentle belly rub
item.description: If you think hedgehogs don’t require slow, sensual belly rubs set to jazz, then you are dead wrong.

item.title: TSA tells the tragic tale of a giant abandoned teddy bear
item.description: In case 2016 hasn’t shattered your soul yet, this Transportation Security Administration (TSA) Instagram post will probably do the trick.

item.title: The best (and worst) news bloopers of 2016
item.description: The year 2016 may have been an awful wasteland but at least the news bloopers were entertaining.

item.title: Trump rally sucker-punch case comes to a happy ending of forgiveness
item.description: After a long, brutal presidential campaign punctuated with calls for violence from President-elect Donald Trump that sometimes came to fruition, one example of a physical political confrontation has gotten a happy ending and given our dead, cold hearts a sliver of hope.

item.title: World's best parents brought their daughter's stuffed animal to life for Christmas
item.description: More than anything, this little girl wanted her stuffed animal, “Luna” to transform into a real dog.

item.title: 'Solace' clip shows confrontation between Jeffrey Dean Morgan and Abbie Cornish
item.description: What happens when you mix science, the supernatural, and some good old fashioned sass?

item.title: Woman expertly trolls people who won't stop asking when she's having kids
item.description: Choosing to have children is one of the most important, personal decisions a human can make. So, naturally, it’s one of the decisions people love to be nosy about.

item.title: James Franco and Bryan Cranston face off in game of Who Said It?
item.description: Bryan Cranston and James Franco, stars of the new movie Why Him?, guess which quotes were said by a man from Florida or by a tech billionaire.

item.title: Santa and his reindeer buddy make the perfect festive biker team
item.description: We all know Santa and his reindeer travel by sleigh on Christmas eve, but what about the rest of the time?

item.title: Somebody supercut 400 versions of 'A Christmas Carol' in one video
item.description: It would take a crazy amount of commitment to watch the hundreds of versions (yep, there’s that many) of Charles Dickens’ famed A Christmas Carol.

item.title: This touching dog rescue story will rip your heart out and mend it simultaneously
item.description: Earlier this year, Hope For Paws, an animal rescue based out of California, received a tip that a wolf was walking the streets of Los Angeles. When the team found the animal, later named Julia, she was suffering from mange, multiple bacterial infections and malnutrition.

item.title: Here are the top 11 songs of 2016
item.description: When the world seemed like it was melting (not literally, but that too), we had music.

item.title: The FBI wants you to know hacking is bad, fellow kids
item.description: Like everyone else, the FBI has had a tough 2016. Between their court battle with Apple and director James Comey’s controversial role in the presidential election, it’s been a wild ride — but is that any excuse for lame ass tweets?

item.title: Oculus Avatars lets you become the badass you really are in VR
item.description: One of the most fun parts of using the Oculus Rift is almost hidden in plain sight, and it’s called Oculus Avatars.

item.title: 'SNL' alum Taran Killam joins 'Hamilton'
item.description: It’s good to be the king. Just ask Taran Killam. The former SNL star will be making his Broadway debut on January 17th as King George in the blockbuster musical Hamilton, producers announced Wednesday, per Variety.

item.title: Transgender artist bravely chronicles her transition in simple comics
item.description: The complexities of transitioning and gender dysphoria can be hard to put into words. But art can fill in the gaps — and one artist is breaking the silence with her simple comics.

item.title: Meet the two brothers rowing naked across the Atlantic Ocean
item.description: If you’re going to row a boat across the Atlantic Ocean, you should probably do it naked.

item.title: Fifth Harmony's Lauren Jauregui arrested for possession of marijuana
item.description: Fifth Harmony’s Lauren Jauregui was arrested for possession of marijuana.

item.title: Trump and the world's biggest tech leaders are meeting right now at Trump Tower
item.description: The giants of Silicon Valley gathered at Trump Tower in New York City Wednesday to meet with the president-elect and discuss the future of tech under the incoming administration — and, presumably, to smooth over some lingering (one-sided) feuds.

item.title: These artists blow air in molten glass to make beautiful Christmas ornaments
item.description: Like everyone else, the FBI has had a tough 2016. Between their court battle with Apple and director James Comey’s controversial role in the presidential election, it’s been a wild ride — but is that any excuse for lame ass tweets?

item.title: The polar vortex is poised to punch you in the face, repeatedly
item.description: You know it’s going to be cold when the National Weather Service hoists wind chill advisories and warnings from North Dakota to Maine. These areas are accustomed to cold, but even so, the prediction of dangerous conditions — with wind chills of at least minus-30 degrees Fahrenheit, and possibly as low as minus-45 degrees — is impressive.

item.title: Amazon just made its first legit delivery via drone
item.description: With a recent flurry of notable activity, the wearable market looks to be in a state of flux.

item.title: IBM's Watson supercomputer discovers 5 new genes linked to ALS
item.description: IBM Watson is known for its work in identifying cancer treatments and beating contestants on Jeopardy! But now the computing system has expertise in a new area of research: neuroscience.

item.title: This $30,000 ugly Christmas sweater is for fancy people
item.description: It should be a comfort to know that the world’s most expensive Christmas sweater still checks off the “ugly” box.

item.title: Poor reporter wipes out on an electric scooter on live TV
item.description: The local news loves to put its reporters into situations that will surely land them in disaster.

item.title: Poor reporter wipes out on an electric scooter on live TV
item.description: The local news loves to put its reporters into situations that will surely land them in disaster.

item.title: Calling Bridget Jones one of the most influential women of the past 70 years is problematic
item.description: LONDON — Bridget Jones is the hapless, chain-smoking singleton who made granny pants sexy, and introduced “fuckwits” into our vernacular. Is she also one of the most powerful women of the past 70 years? Yes, according to BBC’s 2016 Power List which listed her as one of seven women who’ve had the biggest impact on British women’s lives.

item.title: There was one big absence at Donald Trump's tech summit
item.description: We should know by now that Donald Trump has no problem casting aside the things and people he appears to love.

item.title: Kanye West is proud of his signed Trump 'Time' cover for some reason
item.description: Kanye West’s Donald Trump-inspired return to Twitter continues to be an ugly, dark, twisted reality.

item.title: Medium's year in review shows a tech industry hooked on 2016 politics
item.description: Medium has for the first time shared its own reflections on 2016. Yes, the place that is commonly known as a platform for musing on your decision to leave New York City or close your startup has detailed its growth on becoming so much more.

item.title: Climbing to creative freedom (Paid content by Coors Light)
item.description: The complexities of transitioning and gender dysphoria can be hard to put into words. But art can fill in the gaps — and one artist is breaking the silence with her simple comics.

item.title: Director Mike Mills on the real people who inspired '20th Century Women'
item.description: “It’s all about the mother,” says Julie (Elle Fanning) to Dorothea (Annette Bening) in 20th Century Women. That’s the secret employed by the film’s writer and director Mike Mills, as discussed in a new featurette debuting exclusively by Mashable.

item.title: Silicon Valley heavyweights will be advising Donald Trump
item.description: Elon Musk, chairman and CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, and Travis Kalanick, CEO and co-founder of Uber, are officially joining Donald Trump’s advisory board.

item.title: Facebook just accidentally emailed a reporter their secret opinions about Donald Trump
item.description: In the canon of corporate email screwups, this one’s pretty great: A Facebook spokesperson accidentally sent an email to a Buzzfeed reporter instead of the colleague they thought they were forwarding the email to, and in the email, called President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed Muslim registry a “straw man.”…

item.title: Jimmy Fallon and Jon Glaser achieve maximum comfort with the help of bizarre hoodies
item.description: By now, Jimmy Fallon is a professional when it comes to getting someone comfortable as a guest on The Tonight Show—but when Jon Glaser stopped by on Tuesday night, it just was the opposite.

item.title: No one enjoys baths more than this pug puppy
item.description: Gaze at this tiny pug falling asleep mid-bath and watch your heart melt into a glorious puppy puddle.

item.title: The ultimate guide to the 104 new emoji in iOS 10.2
item.description: While the #1 internet treat is Beyonc dropping a new album, Apple dropping new emoji comes as a pretty close second.

item.title: These Muslim women have the best way to fight Islamophobia
item.description: A group of young Muslim women have taken action against Islamophobia in the best possible way. With love.

item.title: 28 gift ideas for people who can’t believe how shitty 2016 was
item.description: The year 2016 was a rough one, to say the least. Add that to the stress of the holidays and this very well may be the most stressed out some people have ever been.

item.title: Here's what Richard Sherman thinks about Thursday Night Football
item.description: If there are two things to know about Richard Sherman, it’s that he 1) despises the NFL and 2) has #nofilter.

item.title: Rick Perry vowed to scrap the Energy Department. Now he may lead it.
item.description: Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas, once said the U.S. Department of Energy “needs to be done away with.”…

item.title: Google's driverless cars will now have to prove themselves as a real business
item.description: After it looked to be putting our self-driving dreams on hold (for a moment, at least), Google parent company Alphabet has revealed its real plans for driverless cars. The project, previously one of the major endeavors of Google X, is getting spun out into its own independent company.

item.title: Tinder on TV is your new favourite party game
item.description: LONDON — Move aside Monopoly. And charades for that matter. The game everyone will be playing this party season is Tinder. Yes, Tinder.

item.title: How a pair of leather trousers reduced the government into a bunch of 'Mean Girls'
item.description: LONDON — Never mind Brexit and Britain’s economic future, it’s a pair of designer trousers worn by the UK Prime Minister Theresa May and the childish spat that followed that’s currently dominating headlines.

item.title: Cuddly dog absolutely nails 'Star Wars' Ewok audition
item.description: Once again, Munchkin the dog has donned his Ewok costume — this time, in honor of Rogue One.

item.title: All it takes is a lot of makeup and you too can look like Mariah Carey
item.description: A little contour, a lot of blending, some highlights, liners and BAM—you can look like Mariah Carey.

item.title: Tinder is coming to Apple TV -- your family room is no longer safe
item.description: If spending the holiday season single weren’t already stressful enough, Tinder and Apple are joining forces to bring swiping for dates to the family room.

item.description: Ricky Gervais has got his priorities right.

item.description: The new E.L.F. bot at the Mall of America wants to be your little shopping helper.

item.title: Online 'Hamilton' ticket queue proves there is no God/life is meaningless/you should just quit now
item.description: The smash Broadway musical Hamilton may be coming to your city next year — but you might as well give up your dreams now of scoring a ticket. You’re one of at least 100,000 people nearby with exactly the same idea at exactly the same time.

item.description: Awesomely bad (but actually good) holiday beards have infiltrated social media. For better or for worse, these curiously blinged out beards seem to be here to stay.

item.description: Great art begets great art.

item.description: Do yourself a favor and go see La La Land when it comes to your city.

item.title: You can swap Snap Spectacle lenses - here's how
item.description: Police in Washington, D.C. have arrested a man armed with an assault rifle who claimed he was investigating “#Pizzagate,” the fictitious conspiracy theory about Hillary Clinton running a child sex ring inside a restaurant.

item.title: Samsung's about to do something deeply disturbing, whether you own a Note 7 or not
item.description: If you bought a Samsung Galaxy Note7, Samsung really, really wants you to stop using it. How much? The company plans to push out a software update next week to the potentially explosive Note7 devices in the U.S. that will prevent them from charging or connecting to a mobile network—effectively rendering them useless.

item.title: Trump team's questions for the Energy Department are unusual
item.description: The Trump transition team sent an unusually detailed questionnaire to the Energy Department, seeking, among other information, lists of people involved in climate change programs at one of the premier science agencies in the world.

item.title: Did PewDiePie delete his main channel?
item.description: How does one become a master at trolling? Perhaps by taking notes from top YouTuber PewDiePie, who claimed he would delete his channel after 50 million subscribers and instead Friday deleted a secondary channel he barely uses.

item.title: Samsung is taking a drastic step to permanently end the Galaxy Note 7 fiasco
item.description: While production and sale of new Samsung Galaxy Note 7 devices stopped back in October, some users have been slow to give up their ticking timebombs defective handsets.

item.title: Feast your hungry eyes on the 'Doctor Who' Christmas Special trailer
item.description: A couple of weeks back we were treated to a clip from the upcoming Doctor Who Christmas special — and now the full trailer is here.

item.title: Go ahead and watch the best 'Hairspray Live!' number right here, right now
item.description: Prepared to be shocked, simply shocked: Jennifer Hudson still totally slays.

item.title: Everyone hates Facebook's 'Year in Review,' not just you

item.description: Nintendo fanboys and girls, the definitive live rendition of the Super Mario theme song is here.

item.title: The one video you need to catch up on this year's internet trends
item.description: There’s no better way to celebrate a year of viral trends than with a group of viral stars.

item.title: 2016 was supposed to be the year of VR. Instead, another star stole the show
item.description: All signs pointed to a revolution: Powerful VR headsets — Facebook’s Oculus Rift, the HTC Vive and Sony’s PlayStation VR were about to make their official, consumer-ready debuts, while Google’s Cardboard and Samsung’s Gear VR we’re making noise in mobile. The stage was set for 2016 to be the year virtual reality took off.

item.title: These 'Hidden Figures' portraits profile brainy, badass women
item.description: Great art begets great art.

item.title: Fitbit buys its struggling rival Pebble
item.description: Fitbit wants Pebble’s technology, but not its hardware.

item.title: How to get a job at Facebook — and why you'd want one
item.description: Once again, Facebook’s being recognized as an incredible place to work. Glassdoor’s annual list ranks it as the number one tech company to work for, based on the last year in employee reviews.

item.title: Samsung gets a big chunk of money back from Apple
item.description: Three months after Apple secured a huge court win over rival Samsung, the United States Supreme Court has stepped in and reversed the previous ruling, throwing out hundreds of millions of dollars in damages and sending the case back to a lower court.

item.title: How Oculus and 3D printers will let artists sculpt with digital clay
item.description: Now that we finally have the Oculus Rift’s Touch controllers, VR gaming on the platform is about to get a lot more interactive. However, based on a video released by Oculus on Monday, the best use of the Touch controller may turn out be Medium, a software tool from Oculus that allows you to sculpt with digital clay in virtual reality.

item.title: Singer lulls puppy to sleep with a capella Christmas tune
item.description: No matter how cute your puppy is, sometimes making him sleep is the only way to get yourself a little peace and quiet.

item.title: Oculus Touch finally makes the Rift a complete VR experience
item.description: Imagine trying to climb a mountain without using your hands. That’s what it’s been like using an Oculus Rift since the category-defining virtual reality headset landed in March.

item.title: 'I saw my fear': How psychedelic therapy is making a comeback
item.description: After learning in 2010 that she had Stage 1 ovarian cancer, Dinah Bazer felt optimistic. Her doctors had just removed the grapefruit-sized tumor bulging from her belly and started her on a course of chemotherapy.

item.title: How to make sure your laptop isn't one of thousands left with the TSA this holiday season
item.description: With Thanksgiving just past us and Christmas still to come, we’re right in the heart of the holiday travel season, so it’s a good time to remind you to stop leaving your laptop at TSA airport checkpoints.

item.description: Teens high on pain killers after getting their wisdom teeth pulled out of their face will never fail to provide hilarious situations.

item.description: LOS ANGELES — Casey Neistat is officially over vlogging.

item.description: Vice President-elect Mike Pence was roundly booed by the audience when he saw Hamilton on Friday night. And the cast had a statement for him after curtain call.

item.description: The problem of fake news on social media platforms like Facebook misinforming Americans was seriously addressed by none other than President Barack Obama Thursday.

item.title: Facebook is finally taking a step to combat fake news
item.description: Facebook is hesitant to purge any information from your News Feed — even fake news. But that doesn’t mean it doesn’t have tools to combat sites that profit from the spread of misinformation.

item.title: Keep your legs warm with your quotes from your favorite books
item.description: If you like reading on the subway but hate schlepping a heavy book with you, there are a few solutions: You could get an e-reader, you could listen to an audiobook or you could wear your literature.

item.description: LONDON — The holidays can be a wonderful time of year — filled with laughter, friends and family.

item.title: The 5 most surprising things from Donald Trump's '60 Minutes' interview

item.title: Facebook failed America this year — now it should kill the News Feed

item.title: FBI basically says 'my bad,' clears Clinton in latest email investigation
item.description: FBI director James Comey has pulled a “my bad,” releasing a letter that confirms Hillary Clinton will not face charges related to the most recent investigation into her use of a private email server.

item.title: The Apple Watch just got a selfie camera
item.description: Despite its many functions, one of the biggest questions about the Apple Watch from its critics — namely, what is it for? — may have finally been answered. Now it’s a selfie camera viewer and video recorder on your wrist, when combined with the new CMRA camera band for Apple Watch.

item.title: Billionaire Peter Thiel: 'Single-digit millionaires’ have it so hard
item.description: Peter Thiel is fighting for the little guy, the everyday people who maybe only have a few million in the bank and therefore aren’t entitled to their day in court.

item.title: Facebook is testing a new Snapchat clone in a different app
item.description: In what is quickly becoming an all too familiar story: Facebook is — once again — attempting a Snapchat clone. And this time, the company is putting it right inside its main app.

item.title: UberEats is going to feel a lot like Uber thanks to this new feature
item.description: UberEats now officially feels more like Uber than Grubhub.

item.title: RIP Vine: Here's what users had to say about the platform's demise
item.description: LOS ANGELES — Vine’s death, however inevitable it seemed, upset many digital influencers.

item.title: Samsung's revenue and profit plummet after Note7 recall
item.description: As expected, Samsung’s revenue and profit have fallen sharply in the third quarter of 2016, due to a painful recall of the company’s flagship smartphone, the Galaxy Note7, due to combusting battery issues.

item.title: Hired wants finding a job to be like online dating, minus the ick
item.description: Hired likes to compare itself with an online dating service, but for tech jobs.

item.title: Facebook's experimental app uses AI to turn live video into fine art
item.description: LAGUNA BEACH, California — Facebook just gave an early look into an experimental camera app that uses artificial intelligence to make live video look like art.

item.title: You damn well should care about the AT&T and Time Warner deal
item.description: If you’re not a media wonk, it can be hard to really care about things like the $80 billion deal between AT&T and Time Warner. But you should. You definitely should.

item.title: Nintendo just revealed a new console, and it's like nothing we've ever seen before

item.description: Apple’s iPhone sales might be slowing down in the rest of the world, but they grew by a phenomenal 56% in India last quarter, one of the few bright spots in Apple’s otherwise “dismal” earnings. No wonder then Apple has big plans for the world’s fastest-growing smartphone market, that includes setting up its stores and selling refurbished iPhones (or is that iPhone devices?) in the country. But it is likely going to be a steep uphill climb.

item.title: Chris Sacca: 'As a culture, we don't treat our girls as potential business leaders'
item.description: Chris Sacca sits in a mostly empty plain white room in his Manhattan Beach, California home, far from the power brokers in San Francisco and New York. The room’s lack of color only emphasizes his own abundance of it: Sacca sports his trademark black cowboy dress shirt, lush auburn beard, mussed hair and that biting corporate straight talk that rattles Twitter’s board room and stock prices on Wall Street.

item.title: The new Moto 360 isn't perfect, but it's one pretty smartwatch [REVIEW]

item.description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is considering offering more shares in its IPO, a move that could make its initial public offering the largest ever, according to a report.

item.title: FCC Proposal Would End Net Neutrality as We Know It
item.description: The FCC says it will propose Internet regulations that would allow online content providers to negotiate for preferential treatment from Internet service providers, potentially underminingthe principles of net neutrality.

item.title: Yahoo Mail Accounts Hacked, Passwords Reset
item.description: An unspecified number of Yahoo Mail users have had their usernames and passwords compromised, the company announced late Thursday. The hack appears to have taken place via a compromised third party database, and Yahoo has taken the precaution of resetting the passwords of affected users.

item.title: Jean-Claude Van Damme's Epic Split for Volvo is Insane
item.description: A lot of auto ads run a disclaimer that the stunt was performed by professionals and viewers shouldn’t try this at home. You’d definitely be wise to take that advice with regards to this ad Volvo Trucks featuring action star Jean-Claude Van Damme.

item.title: Square Cash Streamlines Swapping Money via Email
item.description: Square introduced Square Cash Tuesday, a new way to send and receive cash from your friends or acquaintances using email — no account or sign-up required.

item.title: 13 Deep Thoughts from Jack Dorsey
item.description: Ahead of Twitter’s looming IPO, the business and media worlds have a newfound fascination with Twitter founder and Square CEO Jack Dorsey. In the space of a few weeks, he’s been the subject of a lengthy New Yorker profile, a new book by New York Times technology reporter Nick Bilton and countless blog posts questioning his actual role in the creation of Twitter.

item.title: Jack Dorsey's Reputation Takes a Beating in New Book
item.description: You don’t know Jack. That’s the big takeaway from an excerpt of an upcoming tell-all book on Twitter written by New York Times reporter Nick Bilton.

item.title: Google Introduces New Flatter Logo
item.description: Google is the latest tech company to roll out a new logo, following in the footsteps of Yahoo and Bing.

item.title: Why Apple Unveiled 2 iPhones This Year
item.description: Ever since Apple introduced the original iPhone in 2007, it has adhered to a standard formula: Introduce one updated model the following year, discount the previous model and kill off models that are more than two year old. This year, Apple decided to shake things up by introducing two new iPhone models, discontinuing the iPhone 5, but keeping the 4S as free with a contract.

item.title: Facebook Is Wooing Celebs to Out-Twitter Twitter
item.description: Fans of tennis superstar Maria Sharapova might have noted she used the hashtag #misstheopen in an otherwise mundane tweet last week about seeing “The Book of Mormon” on Broadway.

item.title: Apple: Get Ready For a 'Very Busy Fall'
item.description: Apple has a message for customers and investors: new products are coming soon.

item.title: Square Lets You Send Cash Via Email
item.description: A few days after Google announced the ability to send money via email, mobile payments purveyor Square has done the same.

item.title: You Can Now Send Money Via Gmail
item.description: Google tacked another announcement onto a day full of them with an update to Google Wallet that lets you send money via Gmail.

item.title: Internet Eats Up Guy Fieri's Awesomely Bad NYT Restaurant Review
item.description: New York Times restaurant critic Pete Wells packed a fork and his appetite for a trip to Flavor Town, USA to review Guy Fieri’s new Times Square restaurant, Guy’s American Kitchen & Bar. The sprawling 500-seat eatery and its adjective-heavy menu did little to impress the Times foodie. Wells shared his distaste in a stinging write-up that has spread around the web since publishing on Tuesday.

item.title: Alibaba Buys Back 20% Stake From Yahoo for $7.1 Billion
item.description: Chinese e-commerce site Alibaba has bought half of Yahoo’s stake in the company — 20% of Alibaba’s shares — back from Yahoo for $7.1 billion.

item.title: HOW TO: Connect With Mashable on the Social Web
item.description: As Mashable continues to grow, so do the number of topics we cover and the ways readers access our content. Many readers visit the website directly or subscribe to our RSS feed, daily emails or Twitter and Facebook pages. Now that we’re even more connected across social spaces, we thought we’d let you know how to find us however works best for you.
